meanings.definition: The quality of being delicious or appetizing.
meanings.sent1: The toothsomeness of the freshly baked cookies made everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent2: The toothsomeness of the ripe strawberries made them irresistible.
meanings.sent3: The toothsomeness of the chocolate cake was so tempting that I couldn't resist a second slice.
meanings.sent4: The toothsomeness of the homemade soup warmed both body and soul.
meanings.sent5: The toothsomeness of the juicy burger was unmatched by any other dish on the menu.

meanings.definition: The act of being pleasing or attractive to the senses.
meanings.sent1: Her smile had a toothsomeness that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The toothsomeness of the music filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent3: The toothsomeness of the flowers in the garden lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent4: The toothsomeness of the sunset painted the sky in hues of gold and pink.
meanings.sent5: The toothsomeness of the artwork captivated all who beheld it.
